page.title: 01PRIDDY:INTRODUCTION
page.content: The area of study lies within the parish of Priddy, Somerset. The village of Priddy lies just below the 1000 foot contour on the Mendip Hills.. The area is dominated by farm land and forest. The village itself is a scattered settlement of about 500 people. It has been a centre for human activity since prehistoric times. Burial chambers and other earthworks are reminders of the ancient past while the remains of lead mines point to the more recent economic activity. Today the area has become the centre for caving in the Mendip area and the dominant economic activity is farmig and forestry
